name: DXI Glossary
title: DXI Glossary
body:
Overview

This article provides a comprehensive glossary of terms commonly used in the Tivian survey and feedback management system. It covers a wide range of concepts, tools, and features related to survey creation, data collection, analysis, and reporting.

 

Glossary of Terms and Acronyms

Term Explanation
API (Application Programming Interface) A software intermediary that allows two applications to talk to each other. Can be used to feed client's user data into the panel module.
AN (Anonymous Survey) An anonymous link is generated for the survey, which can be answered as often as desired.
Backup ("mirror") A copy of prod from a specific time. Some functions like mails might be productively used.
Boss Button Additional function bar in a survey which allows the user to move between questions without completing mandatory areas. Primarily used for testing phase prior to a questionnaire rollout.
Codebook A data dictionary used for gathering and storing codes. It contains an overview of all variables and labels used in a project.
Container Depot Storage for common questions. When a single response question appears multiple times in a survey (for different users), it reports back as one question.
CX (Customer Experience) This is a part of the Tivian DXI product
Dashboard Platform for visual display of all of your data. Used for both internal and external use to visualize data as well as survey results.
Date Picker Shows a calendar icon within a survey.
Debug Mode Allows users to move between pages without completing mandatory questions. Used during testing.
Disposition Code Status of Respondent. System updates automatically within a project.
DV (Data Voyager) Application to link and prepare PowerPoint reports to the survey environment. Serves as a basis for the preparation of results reports.
DXI (Discover XI)

This is the new name of the EFS product. There have been a number of rebrandings for the product, as follows:

  • Globalpark > Questback > EFS > Tivian XI > Discover XI (DXI)
EFS (Enterprise Feedback Suite) Shared platform for creating and managing feedback projects. From here, web pages as well as panel management can be accessed. Base for every customer project.
ES (Employee Survey) The survey is interwoven with the corporate structure (Org. Structure) so that conclusions can be drawn about individual areas. Mainly used for Employee and Pulse Surveys for larger companies with complex corporate structures.
EX (Employee Experience) This is a part of the Tivian DXI product
Filter A filter can skip or display predefined areas by setting conditions (e.g. certain answers in the questionnaire) which then determines the path a survey follows. Used in questionnaire programming.
G2 Legacy part of CXI; it has been deprecated as of June 2024
Guide A ready-made solution for questioning certain topics. Currently, there are four different guides available: ME-Guide, US-Guide, Topic-Guide, IDEA-Guide.
Hierarchy The organisational structure in which different functions, departments and teams are ranked for the purpose of a survey and its reporting. Used when separate departmental reports are required.
Installation Creation of the survey system or a client's copy of EFS.
KDA (Key Driver Analysis) Statistical analysis (e.g. correlation/regression type analyses) to determine the priority factors driving a core question e.g. NPS/ employee engagement. Used in CX & EX.
Libraries Storage for Media, Images, Lists etc. In EFS - use throughout projects. Can be client specific or common library.
Matrix Multiple-Choice questions using a scale as answers.
MD (Master Data Survey) Gathers responders data e.g sex / age etc. Used in personalised survey / 360 - for HR use (limited data can be shown against users).
Metaname A unique name assigned to a specific organisation unit/person in the org structure. Each unit in an orgstructure must be given a metaname, otherwise import is not possible.
MR (Market Research) This is a part of the Tivian DXI product
MySight An EFS embedded module that provides feedback data optimized for easy use in Tableau. With this data, you can use Tableau to create dynamic dashboards, which are then displayed to the users via EFS Portals.
Org. Processor Part of Tivian's survey tool which relates to the hierarchy. Enables mapping of complex enterprise structures and assignment of users to nodes in the hierarchy. The org. processor also has its own user administration.
Org. Structure A system used to define a hierarchy within an organisation.
PA (Panel Survey) A type of survey that is served in the panel of the participants, via the Portals feature.
Panel The panel module can be used to target respondents who are stored with user-defined data for the respective project. Used as a market research basis to be able to repeatedly survey a predefined panel unit.
Panelist Users within a Guide. A panelist is part of a predefined panel. Panelists serve as a stable population for different surveys.
Participant Those invited / completing a PROJECT survey.
PE (Personalized Survey) Participants are named. Participants can only take part in the survey once.
Portal Tivian's online site, used as a 'one-stop shop' for respondents/users to complete surveys, access reports/dashboards and for action planning.
Psychological Safety Work environments that allow team members to feel they can safely take calculated risks without fear of repercussions. Larger clients, especially groups in Germany, regularly conduct surveys on psychological danger, part of which can be psychological safety.
Radio Button Single selection answer - shows as a circle within a survey.
Ranking Module which enables rating from top to bottom list.
Recode Recoding converts an answer option to report differently.
Respondent / Rater Those completing a 360° survey.
SaaS (Software as a Service) A subarea of cloud computing where software and IT infrastructure are operated by an external IT service provider and used by the customer as a service.
Sandbox / PlayGround Prod with limited range of functions but newer EFS version. A testing environment in a computer system in which new or untested software or coding can be run securely before being moved to 'production'.
Screen Out Users which do not match the survey requirements (e.g. age) and are therefore immediately redirected to a final page. Used in CX / EX / MR surveys (not a 360°).
SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol) A secure site which can be accessed by parties with permission to upload or download documents, reports etc.
Tableau Data visualization software, used for building dashboards.
Trigger Sets a specific path in motion. A trigger can be used to automatically insert pre-entered data using wild cards. For example, customer data can be automatically inserted into survey response options.
UAT (User Acceptance Test) A short phase of a project used for testing an online survey/reporting/dashboards prior to release to users. Tivian and Client complete. Client sign off.
Variable The smallest storage unit of project information. It can be differentiated, for example, into questionnaire or participant variables.
Wildcard A code snippet which can be used in questionnaires and/or mail templates to place pre-stored information.
WIP (Work in Progress) The total accumulated costs or revenue on a project that is still in progress.
Whitelist / Whitelisting An organisation's list of permitted/approved SPF addresses, email addresses and/or IP addresses. Mail from 'whitelisted' email addresses, domains, and/or IP addresses is a measure to take to avoid being classified as 'spam'. Advisable that all new clients add Tivian's details to their whitelist.
360° Self / Peer assessment. Used for employees to respond to leaders / leaders rate themselves.
